metadata.title: CVE-2022-37454 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The Keccak XKCP SHA-3 reference implementation before fdc6fef has aninteger overflow and resultant buffer overflow that allows attackers toexecute arbitrary code or eliminate expected cryptographic properties. Thisoccurs in the sponge function interface.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-37454` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.2 - 7.2.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.15

criterions.comment: php7.2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.2.24-0ubuntu0.18.04.15').
pysha3 package in bionic is affected and may need fixing.
python3.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.7.5-2ubuntu1~18.04.2+esm2').
python3.8 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.8.0-3ubuntu1~18.04.2+esm1').
python3.6 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.10').
